# Target Corporation <> iExcel — Growth Systems Proposal

How iExcel will convert Target's category-leading social reach into measurable owned audience growth and repeatable revenue lift.

*Prepared by iExcel • December 29, 2025*

## Executive Summary

Target is a mature, omnichannel retailer operating 1,989 stores nationwide and delivering approximately $107B in 2024 net sales. Its store-as-hubs model puts 75%+ of the U.S. population within 10 miles of a Target location, enabling fast pickup/drive-up and same-day delivery at scale.

Target's differentiators—design-forward owned brands, strong loyalty (Target Circle / Card / 360), and a retail media platform (Roundel)—create multiple revenue levers across consumer and B2B buyer types.

The dossier shows Target has already built elite social performance: 6.2M+ Instagram followers, 3.2M TikTok followers with 2.5–4.0% engagement, and campaigns that generate massive cultural reach (e.g., Target Santa at 70M+ social mentions).

The growth bottleneck is no longer awareness; it's conversion and measurement—turning high-performing social moments into repeatable, attributable outcomes such as Circle sign-ups, app actions, and basket lift.

iExcel recommends a focused 12-week engagement to implement an owned-audience growth engine: unify segmentation across channels, automate engagement→conversion pathways, and stand up decision-ready reporting for scale/pivot decisions.

## What We Learned

• **Social mastery is already a strength.** Target's multi-platform strategy and "Tarzhay" identity create category-leading reach and brand coherence; the upside now is extracting more measurable value per impression.

• **TikTok is the engagement engine.** TikTok engagement rates (2.5–4.0%) materially outperform retail benchmarks and appear to be Target's best lever for demand creation and cultural moments.

• **Instagram is the premium showcase, but engagement headroom exists.** Instagram's scale (6.2M+ followers) is massive; improving interactive formats and conversion paths can meaningfully increase downstream actions.

• **Loyalty + social commerce are a natural flywheel.** The dossier highlights strong integration between social campaigns and Target Circle—this is the right "owned" destination to optimize and measure.

• **Seasonal excellence can be productized into a repeatable playbook.** Campaign spikes are proven; systematizing audience building and retargeting is how spikes become compounding growth.

• **Channel mix should follow marginal return.** Twitter/X is trending down and Facebook organic reach is structurally constrained—paid amplification and smarter audience reuse become more important.

## Quote

*(NEEDS DISCOVERY: confirm stakeholder)*

> "We can generate massive social attention, but the real question is how consistently we turn it into Circle sign-ups, app actions, and attributable sales—without slowing the content engine."
> 
> — Director of Social & Commerce

## What We Found

| Area | Finding | Impact / Opportunity |
|------|---------|---------------------|
| **Social → Owned Conversion** | High reach/engagement on TikTok & Instagram; conversion pathways to Circle/app/value exchange are not specified in the dossier (NEEDS DISCOVERY). | Design a consistent social-to-owned funnel with clear CTAs, landing destinations/deep links, and retargeting rules tied to loyalty outcomes. |
| **Audience Segmentation** | Multiple audience segments span consumer and B2B (Roundel advertisers); cross-channel segment definitions are not documented (NEEDS DISCOVERY). | Create a segment map and operationalize audiences for paid, lifecycle, and measurement—so campaigns can be repeated without rework. |
| **Automation & Lifecycle** | Cross-platform synergy is strong, but an automation framework is not detailed (NEEDS DISCOVERY). | Implement automated audience syncing and lifecycle triggers that move engaged users into conversion journeys (Circle enrollment, app actions, subscriptions). |
| **Measurement & Decisioning** | Social health is excellent, but KPI baselines and attribution are not included (NEEDS DISCOVERY). | Define event taxonomy + reporting that links engagement to outcomes and supports mid-campaign scale/pivot decisions. |
| **Optimization Cadence** | Platform nuances are understood, but the testing system and learnings loop are not formalized (NEEDS DISCOVERY). | Stand up a weekly experimentation cadence: content-to-audience mapping, retargeting tests, and performance insights feeding creative decisions. |

## Recommended Approach — Outcome-Based Phases

### Phase 1: Audience & Measurement Blueprint (Weeks 1–3)

• **Alignment & goals.** Confirm the primary conversion outcomes (e.g., Circle sign-ups, app engagement, subscriptions) and success criteria.
• **Audience map.** Map Target's segments to channel behaviors and establish targeting priorities.
• **Measurement plan.** Define key events, attribution questions, UTM standards, and dashboard spec (NEEDS DISCOVERY: current analytics stack).
• **Deliverable.** Audience Growth Blueprint (segment map, funnel map, measurement spec, activation backlog).

### Phase 2: Systems Build & Automation (Weeks 4–8)

• **Audience setup.** Implement audience development setup across agreed platforms (CRM/ESP + paid + social engagement audiences).
• **Automation.** Configure syncing, retargeting rules, and lifecycle triggers from engagement → owned conversion events.
• **Reusable campaign kit.** Operationalize a seasonal-drop kit (audiences, CTAs, creative-to-segment mapping).
• **Deliverable.** Working audience + automation system with documented rules and governance.

### Phase 3: Activation, Optimization & Handoff (Weeks 9–12)

• **Optimization cycles.** Run weekly performance + audience reviews and refine conversion pathways.
• **Prioritized experiments.** Launch 2–3 tests (e.g., micro-influencer amplification, live commerce pilot, engagement-to-Circle retargeting).
• **Enablement.** Prepare handoff documentation and internal enablement for ongoing operations.
• **Deliverable.** Optimization report + scale plan + internal playbook.

## Tactical Work Plan & Timeline

| Week | Milestone |
|------|-----------|
| 1 | Kickoff · access provisioning · confirm primary conversion outcomes + data sources |
| 2–3 | Audience Growth Blueprint (segments, funnels, measurement spec) |
| 4 | Audience setup across selected platforms · audience taxonomy locked |
| 5–6 | Automation implementation (syncing, triggers, retargeting rules) |
| 6 | Decision gate: midpoint review · scale/pivot decisions for activation plan |
| 7–8 | Seasonal campaign kit build · test plan finalized · launch readiness |
| 9–10 | Activation + optimization cycles · 2 prioritized experiments live |
| 11 | Performance review · recommendations for scale + resourcing |
| 12 | Handoff documentation · next-phase scoping (optional retainer support) |

## Expected Outcomes (Modeled)

| KPI | Baseline | Target |
|-----|----------|--------|
| Circle enrollments from social journeys | NEEDS DISCOVERY | +10–25% vs. baseline (pilot period) |
| Owned list growth (email/SMS/app opt-ins) | NEEDS DISCOVERY | +15–30% driven by campaign value exchange |
| Social → owned conversion rate | NEEDS DISCOVERY | +20–40% via clearer CTAs + retargeting |
| Retargeting ROAS / incremental revenue per engaged user | NEEDS DISCOVERY | +10–20% improvement (modeled) |
| Time-to-launch for audience-based campaigns | NEEDS DISCOVERY | Reduce by 25–40% via reusable segment + automation kit |

*Modeled using large-retail and e-commerce benchmarks; actual results depend on creative mix, media investment, offer strategy, seasonality, and data/tech constraints.*

## Pricing & Investment

### Option A — Owned Audience Growth Engine (Recommended)

• **Scope.** Strategy + setup + automation + optimization cadence for social-to-owned conversion and measurable outcomes.
• **One-time setup.** Audience Development Strategy ($1,275) + Setup ($1,175) + Automation ($1,425) + Optimization ($1,450) = **$5,325**
• **Ongoing support.** Audience Development Management: $1,600/mo (optional after Week 8)
• **Optional add-on.** Audience Enrichment: $1,475 (if match rates / data quality require)
• **Media budget.** Paid directly to platforms (NEEDS DISCOVERY)

### Option B — Foundation Sprint (Lean)

• **Scope.** Blueprint + core automation build, with handoff for internal teams to operate.
• **One-time.** Audience Development Strategy ($1,275) + Automation ($1,425) = **$2,700**
• **Optional monthly support.** Audience Development Management: $1,600/mo
• **Media budget.** Paid directly to platforms (NEEDS DISCOVERY)

**Payment terms:** 50% due at kickoff, balance due on Phase 2 completion. Month-to-month support available after Phase 2/Week 8.

## Open items to confirm in discovery (to finalize scope and KPIs):

• **KPI priority.** Circle enrollments vs. app engagement vs. subscription growth vs. Roundel outcomes.
• **Measurement stack.** GA4/GTM/Adobe, CRM/ESP, CDP, attribution model, and access requirements.
• **Conversion pathways.** Existing social landing pages/app deep links/Circle enrollment flows and known friction points.
